title.narrative: WFP Response to Humanitarian Needs of Flood Affected People in South Sudan

description.narrative:
The CERF contribution enables WFP to replenish about 2,131 metric tons of sorghum, pulses, salt and vegetable oil, to provide up to two months of food rations. WFP are using the food they have in stock to ensure a rapid response and then will replenish with the CERF funds. Assistance is being provided to approximately 121,524 flood affected people.
The Logistics Cluster has been supporting the delivery of Non-Food Items (NFIs) comprising of protection, WASH, health related items to IDPs in flood affected locations in Rubkona County (including Bentiu); however, air has been the only mode of transport into Bentiu – of both people and supplies – for all humanitarian partners. If the flooding situation gets worse and should one of the protective dykes surrounding the airstrip get breached, the airstrip in Bentiu will have to close and reliance of the humanitarian community will solely be on helicopters. As a critical enabler of common services for the humanitarian community in South Sudan, WFP (through the Logistics Cluster) has requested the CERF funding to work on the rehabilitation of the critical access routes. Activities include: 1) clearing of the riverway from Manga port to Bentiu; 2) Repair of emergency choke points along the main transport route to flooded areas in Bentiu/Rubkona to enable access from the Yida (northern corridor) and along the road from Abeinmom to Mayom.
